programmes.show_description: The Pendulum Draws The Eye: Two episodes remain in the series and with Greg Davies's shiny head trophy within touching distance, tensions are beginning to run high between the contestants.
Tall tales from celebrity panellists. Host Rob Brydon and regulars David Mitchell and Lee Mack welcome guests David O'Doherty, Katherine Parkinson, Bill Turnbull and Louie Spence.
Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis look back on news gone by in the company of guests Maisie Adam, Angela Barnes, Rhys James, Robin Morgan and Ahir Shah.
Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis excavate the treasures of the past with the help of guests Maisie Adam, Angela Barnes, Ed Byrne, Milton Jones and Kae Kurd.

programmes.show_name: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programmes.show_description: Like Top Gun All Over Again: Can a knock-off can ever be as good as the real thing? Comedian Dave Gorman offers some wry observations on DVDs, baking - and Bucks Fizz.

programmes.show_name: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programmes.show_description: I've Never Seen a Cat: One very funny man and his laptop. Dave plays tricks with singing toys, interrogates kids' TV characters, and messes with Monopoly.
Shopping from Home.
Shopping from Home.
Officers intercept a shipment of hundreds of gun parts headed for Mexico, a nurse is caught smuggling pills in her boots, and a traveller carrying goat meat is inspected.
A tip-off unearths a vast shipment of heroin and cocaine disguised as garbage bags, and officers respond to a medical emergency and deal with a drunken US Marshal.
Pedal-Powered Airship: The motoring fan tries to become the first person to cross the English Channel in a human-powered airship by pedalling a bike suspended from a helium-filled balloon.
Copenhagen: Rick Stein visits Copenhagen, the home of new Nordic cuisine, and cooks fried pork belly with lovage potatoes and parsley sauce, a dish once named as Denmark's favourite.
Officers at Eagle Pass intercept a driver smuggling narcotics over the border, and a group of passengers in Laredo refuse to admit to owning an air compressor full of rifles.
Officers in Progreso detain a man who made a dash back toward Mexico, and the team in Laredo uncovers methamphetamine concealed in a shipment of landscaping stone.
Georgia: Twenty Twelve co-stars Hugh Bonneville and Jessica Hynes face an Olympic-sized task as they take a terrifying road trip through the deadly, winding mountains of Georgia.
High-speed high-jinks - and high trousers - with Clarkson and co, who are joined by pop mogul Simon Cowell. The lads race each other across London using a bike, a boat and a car.
Plenty of fast cars, but no fracas... Richard and James get together some ageing camper vans and a small troop of touring car drivers for Top Gear's inaugural Motorhome Grand Prix!
Hong Kong: The Hairy Bikers are back, touring the birthplaces of favourite Asian cuisines. In Hong Kong they discover the secrets of wok chi at a street food stall.
Copenhagen: Rick Stein visits Copenhagen, the home of new Nordic cuisine, and cooks fried pork belly with lovage potatoes and parsley sauce, a dish once named as Denmark's favourite.
With comedian David Baddiel, former MP Ed Balls, stand-up and actress Jo Brand and ex-Pussycat Doll Kimberly Wyatt.
Sian Gibson, Jean Johansson, Iain Stirling and Rav Wilding make another trip into the Thursday Murder Club creator's quizzing den and try to earn glory this time around.
Former winners Tim Key, Jamie Laing, Sunetra Sarker and Laura Whitmore join the Pointless friend to see which of them will become a Champion of Champions.
Gallimaufrey: Being quite interesting wins points in the offbeat comedy quiz. Stephen Fry introduces Phill Jupitus, Hugh Dennis and Andy Hamilton to a gallimaufrey of gingambobs.

programmes.show_name: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programmes.show_description: Guest host Victoria Coren Mitchell and panellists Joan Bakewell and Fin Taylor join team captain Paul Merton and Ian Hislop.
I Can Hear It Gooping: The series reaches its majestic climax. Who will win Greg Davies's coveted golden head to become just the seventh Taskmaster Champion in history?
Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis excavate the treasures of the past with the help of guests Maisie Adam, Angela Barnes, Ed Byrne, Milton Jones and Kae Kurd.
Challenging each other to discern fact from fiction here are Greg Davies, Konnie Huq, Phil Tufnell and Marcus Brigstocke. With regulars Rob Brydon, David Mitchell and Lee Mack.
With comedian David Baddiel, former MP Ed Balls, stand-up and actress Jo Brand and ex-Pussycat Doll Kimberly Wyatt.
Ice Cream: Now spread out and separated across Belize, the guys must weigh their personal desires against those of their friends' lives to recover the missing money and save Joel.
Broodstock: A charismatic entrepreneur promises to bring the boys home if they complete a mysterious and dangerous mission involving Lawrence, Jesus, and the duffel bag full of Euros.
The court sees some celebrity scandal, as Blue stars Duncan James and Anthony Costa clash over a Brit Award. Two passionate siblings battle over some pooey property.
Shopping from Home.
Shopping from Home.
1970s: The Bikers revisit the 1970s - a food decade that's often stigmatised - and show how a well-prepared chicken cordon bleu and banoffee pie can be a gastronomic delight.
War: The bikers explore how the British have still managed to create remarkable dishes, even in times of war, trying their hand at rabbit stew and carrot cake.
Copenhagen: Rick Stein visits Copenhagen, the home of new Nordic cuisine, and cooks fried pork belly with lovage potatoes and parsley sauce, a dish once named as Denmark's favourite.
High-speed high-jinks - and high trousers - with Clarkson and co, who are joined by pop mogul Simon Cowell. The lads race each other across London using a bike, a boat and a car.
Plenty of fast cars, but no fracas... Richard and James get together some ageing camper vans and a small troop of touring car drivers for Top Gear's inaugural Motorhome Grand Prix!
Siberia: Comedic chums Ed Byrne and Andy Parsons brave freezing temperatures as they drive across Siberia's infamous Road of Bones, encountering icy tracks and deserted gulags.
Ho Chi Minh Trail: Sue Perkins and Liza Tarbuck have to dodge unexploded bombs as they tackle the Ho Chi Minh Trail, a mazy network of dangerous roads through Laos and Vietnam.
Truck Rescue: Guy joins a multi-generational family business who rescue crashed or broken-down HGVs as he learns the physics of truck recovery and operates a crane during a complex rescue.
Mark Bonnar, Sheila Hancock, Stephen Mangan and Anita Rani join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the comedy panel show. Hosted by Rob Brydon.
Comedian James Acaster, TV presenters Gabby Logan and Melvin Odoom, and Cold Feet star Fay Ripley join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show.
Countdown dictionary expert Susie Dent, comedian Bob Mortimer and TV presenters Ore Oduba and Stacey Solomon join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show.
Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show with Steve Davis, Craig Parkinson, Sara Pascoe and Claudia Winkleman joining team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack.
David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by celebrity guests Nikki Fox, Miles Jupp, Nish Kumar and Joe Lycett.
Comedy panel show. Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by guest panellists Adrian Edmondson, Claude Littner, Cariad Lloyd and Jordan Stephens.
New. Oasis: Some might say that Lee and Lucy were foolish to try to buy tickets to see Oasis in concert when they start to blame each other after losing their place in the queue.
New. Dragon Castle: Lee and Lucy look to a career in films when they play background elves on the set of a popular TV series - their aspirations, however, are thwarted by a lack of talent.
New. Hotel Room: When Lee uses his collection of free discount vouchers to stay overnight in a mid-range hotel, he makes sure that he takes advantage of all the hotel's complimentary services.
Gavin is uncomfortable with Gwen and Bryn knowing the details of his and Stacey's sex life. Pete and Dawn prepare to renew their vows.
Bank Holiday Monday sees the Essex mob arrive for a day at the beach in Barry, where Gavin has a heart-to-heart with his dad, while Dave finds Nessa and Smithy enjoying the fair.
With preparations for the wedding in full swing, Stacey has news for Gavin. Bryn and Jason put their big secret to bed, and Smithy has a final chat with Nessa.
